selectedVerses.text: To impose a fine on a righteous man is not good, nor to strike the noble for their uprightness.
for it is better to be told, "Come up here," than to be put lower in the presence of a noble.What your eyes have seen
But he who is noble plans noble things, and on noble things he stands.
The fool will no more be called noble, nor the scoundrel said to be honorable.
Then down marched the remnant of the noble; the people of the LORD marched down for me against the mighty.
